paragraph.paragraph:
This sample demonstrates use of the
THREAD_POOL (ThreadPool) class. The sample queues up an asynchronous method call that is executed by a thread from the thread pool managed by the Common Language Runtime. The method "does some work" and then sets an event indicating that the work has finished. The main thread waits on the event and then exits.
paragraph.heading: 2Compiling
paragraph.paragraph: To see compiling instructions, you have to enable javascript.
paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After you launch the sample, the following output appears:
paragraph.code_block: Main thread: Queuing an asynchronous operation. Main thread: Performing other operations. WorkItem thread: Performing asynchronous operation Main thread: Waiting for asynchronous operation to complete.
paragraph.paragraph: When the display is finished, the application wait for you to pressed the return key to finished the application.
